content:
TabPage Class

Definition

Represents a single tab page in a TabControl.

In this Article

[System.ComponentModel.DefaultEvent("Click")]
[System.ComponentModel.DefaultProperty("Text")]
[System.ComponentModel.Designer("System.Windows.Forms.Design.TabPageDesigner, System.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")]
[System.ComponentModel.DesignTimeVisible(false)]
[System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItem(false)]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ClassInterface(System.Runtime.InteropServices.ClassInterfaceType.AutoDispatch)]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(true)]
public class TabPage : System.Windows.Forms.Panel

Remarks

TabPage controls represent the tabbed pages in a TabControl control. The order of tab pages in the TabPages collection reflects the order of tabs in the TabControl control. To change the order of tabs in the control, you must change their positions in the collection by removing them and inserting them at new indexes.

TabPage controls are constrained by their container, so some of the properties inherited from the Control base class will have no effect, including Top, Height, Left, Width, Show, and Hide.

The tabs in a TabControl are part of the TabControl but not parts of the individual TabPage controls. Members of the TabPage class, such as the ForeColor property, affect only the client rectangle of the tab page, but not the tabs. Additionally, the Hide method of the TabPage will not hide the tab. To hide the tab, you must remove the TabPage control from the TabPages collection.

Note

In .NET Framework 2.0, the tab is considered part of the tab page for determining when the Enter and Leave events of the TabPage occur. In earlier versions of the .NET Framework, the Enter and Leave events of the TabPage do not occur when focus enters or leaves a tab, but only when focus enters or leaves the client rectangle of the tab page.

For more information about how this control responds to the Focus and Select methods, see the following Control members: CanFocus, CanSelect, Focused, ContainsFocus, Focus, Select.

Note

Controls contained in a TabPage are not created until the tab page is shown, and any data bindings in these controls are not activated until the tab page is shown.

In .NET Framework 2.0, the UseVisualStyleBackColor property lets you indicate whether the background of the tab page should render using the current visual style. This occurs only when the UseVisualStyleBackColor and RenderWithVisualStyles property values are both true and the Appearance property of the parent TabControl is TabAppearance. Otherwise, the background is painted normally.

Constructors

TabPage()

Initializes a new instance of the TabPage class.

public TabPage ();

TabPage(String)

Initializes a new instance of the TabPage class and specifies the text for the tab.

public TabPage (string text);
text
String

The text for the tab.

Remarks

The Text property is set to the value of the text parameter.

Properties

Anchor

This member is not meaningful for this control.

public override System.Windows.Forms.AnchorStyles Anchor { get; set; }
Value
AnchorStyles

An AnchorStyles value.

AutoSize

This property is not meaningful for this control.

public override bool AutoSize { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

The default value is false.

AutoSizeMode

This property is not meaningful for this control.

public override System.Windows.Forms.AutoSizeMode AutoSizeMode { get; set; }
Value
AutoSizeMode

The control grows as much as necessary to fit its contents but does not shrink smaller than the value of its size property

BackColor

Gets or sets the background color for the TabPage.

public override System.Drawing.Color BackColor { get; set; }
Value
Color

A Color that represents the background color of the TabPage.

Remarks

The default value of the BackColor property is the value of the DefaultBackColor property unless the UseVisualStyleBackColor and RenderWithVisualStyles property values are both true and the Appearance property of the parent TabControl has a value of TabAppearance, in which case the default value of the BackColor property is Transparent. Child controls that you place on the TabPage inherit the BackColor value by default, so this behavior causes the background of the child controls to render with the current visual style.

Changing the value of the BackColor property automatically sets the UseVisualStyleBackColor property to false. If you want the TabPage background to render using visual styles but you want the child controls to inherit a BackColor value that you specify, set the UseVisualStyleBackColor property after you set the BackColor property.

Dock

This member is not meaningful for this control.

public override System.Windows.Forms.DockStyle Dock { get; set; }
Value
DockStyle

A DockStyle value.

Enabled

This member is not meaningful for this control.

public bool Enabled { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

The default is true.

ImageIndex

Gets or sets the index to the image displayed on this tab.

public int ImageIndex { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The zero-based index to the image in the stem.Windows.Forms.TabControl.ImageList* that appears on the tab. The default is -1, which signifies no image.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

The ImageIndex value is less than -1.

Remarks

The ImageIndex points to an image in the associated ImageList of the TabControl.

ImageKey

Gets or sets the key accessor for the image in the stem.Windows.Forms.TabControl.ImageList* of the associated TabControl.

public string ImageKey { get; set; }
Value
String

A string representing the key of the image.

Remarks

The ImageKey property specifies the image from the image list to display on the control.

Location

This property is not meaningful for this control.

public System.Drawing.Point Location { get; set; }
Value
Point

The x and y coordinates which specifies the location of the object.

MaximumSize

This property is not meaningful for this control.

public override System.Drawing.Size MaximumSize { get; set; }
Value
Size

The upper limit of the size of the objet.

MinimumSize

This property is not meaningful for this control.

public override System.Drawing.Size MinimumSize { get; set; }
Value
Size

The lower limit of the size of the objet.

PreferredSize

This property is not meaningful for this control.

public System.Drawing.Size PreferredSize { get; }
Value
Size

The size of a rectangular area into which the control can fit.

TabIndex

This property is not meaningful for this control.

public int TabIndex { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The tab order of the control.

Remarks

The TabIndex property indicates the order in which controls receive focus as a user presses the TAB key on a form. TabPage controls are contained within TabControl controls, however, and do not receive focus individually as part of the form's TAB order. This property is therefore meaningless for this class.

TabStop

This member is not meaningful for this control.

public bool TabStop { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

The default is true.

Remarks

TabPage controls are contained within TabControl controls and do not receive focus individually as part of the form's TAB order. This property is therefore meaningless for this class.

Text

Gets or sets the text to display on the tab.

public override string Text { get; set; }
Value
String

The text to display on the tab.

Remarks

Changing the Text property value does not automatically center the new value on the tab if the TabControl has a SizeMode property value of TabSizeMode. You can work around this limitation by setting the ItemSize property or by removing the TabPage from the TabPages collection and adding it back to the collection. Both of these actions will automatically center the text.

ToolTipText

Gets or sets the ToolTip text for this tab.

public string ToolTipText { get; set; }
Value
String

The ToolTip text for this tab.

Remarks

This tab page belongs to a TabControl. The ToolTip text appears when the user moves the mouse over the tab if the ShowToolTips property of the TabControl is true. For more information about ToolTips, see the ToolTip class.

UseVisualStyleBackColor

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the TabPage background renders using the current visual style when visual styles are enabled.

public bool UseVisualStyleBackColor { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true to render the background using the current visual style; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

The TabPage background uses the current visual style only when the UseVisualStyleBackColor and RenderWithVisualStyles property values are both true.

When the UseVisualStyleBackColor and RenderWithVisualStyles property values are both true and the Appearance property of the parent TabControl is TabAppearance, the default value of the BackColor property is Transparent. Child controls that you place on the TabPage inherit the BackColor value by default, so this behavior causes the background of the child controls to render with the current visual style.

Changing the value of the BackColor property automatically sets the UseVisualStyleBackColor property to false. If you want the TabPage background to render using visual styles but you want the child controls to inherit a BackColor value that you specify, set the UseVisualStyleBackColor property after you set the BackColor property.

Visible

This member is not meaningful for this control.

public bool Visible { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

The default is true.

Remarks

This member is not meaningful for this control.

To hide a tab in a TabControl, you must remove it from the control's TabPages collection.

Methods

CreateControlsInstance()

Creates a new instance of the control collection for the control.

protected override System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection CreateControlsInstance ();
Returns

A new instance of Control.ControlCollection assigned to the control.

GetTabPageOfComponent(Object)

Retrieves the tab page that contains the specified object.

public static System.Windows.Forms.TabPage GetTabPageOfComponent (object comp);
comp
Object

The object to look for.

Returns
TabPage

The TabPage that contains the specified object, or null if the object cannot be found.

OnEnter(EventArgs)

Raises the Enter event of the TabPage.

protected override void OnEnter (EventArgs e);
e
EventArgs

An EventArgs that contains the event data.

Remarks

In .NET Framework 2.0, the tab is considered part of the tab page for determining when the Enter and Leave events of the TabPage occur. In earlier versions of the .NET Framework, the Enter and Leave events of the TabPage do not occur when focus enters or leaves a tab, but only when focus enters or leaves the client rectangle of the tab page.

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Events.

The OnEnter method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

OnLeave(EventArgs)

Raises the Leave event of the TabPage.

protected override void OnLeave (EventArgs e);
e
EventArgs

An EventArgs that contains the event data.

Remarks

In .NET Framework 2.0, the tab is considered part of the tab page for determining when the Enter and Leave events of the TabPage occur. In earlier versions of the .NET Framework, the Enter and Leave events of the TabPage do not occur when focus enters or leaves a tab, but only when focus enters or leaves the client rectangle of the tab page.

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Events.

The OnLeave method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

OnPaintBackground(PaintEventArgs)

Paints the background of the TabPage.

protected override void OnPaintBackground (System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs e);
e
PaintEventArgs

A PaintEventArgs that contains data useful for painting the background.

Remarks

The system calls this method to paint the background of the TabPage. When the UseVisualStyleBackColor and RenderWithVisualStyles property values are both true and the Appearance property of the parent TabControl is TabAppearance, this method paints the background using the current visual style. Otherwise, this method paints the background as usual.

SetBoundsCore(Int32,Int32,Int32,Int32,BoundsSpecified)

This member overrides stem.Windows.Forms.Control.SetBoundsCore*.

protected override void SetBoundsCore (int x, int y, int width, int height, System.Windows.Forms.BoundsSpecified specified);
x
Int32

The new stem.Windows.Forms.Control.Left* property value of the control.

y
Int32

The new stem.Windows.Forms.Control.Top* property value of the control.

width
Int32

The new stem.Windows.Forms.Control.Width* property value of the control.

height
Int32

The new stem.Windows.Forms.Control.Height* property value of the control.

specified
BoundsSpecified

A bitwise combination of BoundsSpecified values.

ToString()

Returns a string containing the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.TabPage.Text* property.

public override string ToString ();
Returns
String

A string containing the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.TabPage.Text* property.

Occurs when the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.TabPage.Visible* property changes.

Remarks

The Visible property is not meaningful for this control, although you can change its value and handle the VisibleChanged event to detect the change.

To hide a tab in a TabControl, you must remove it from the control's TabPages collection.
